sub_title: (Sr.) Policy Advisor @Ministry of Justice and Security | The Netherlands 🇳🇱
summary:
I’m passionate about contributing to a safe and fair world, both on- and offline.

I have 5+ years of industry level experience in cyber security, innovation, privacy and crisis management with a strong focus on policy and responsible digital (product) development. Currently working at the Dutch Ministry of Justice and Security as a Senior Policy Officer. 

Previously employed within the Deloitte Cyber Risk team focusing on complex crisis management projects, product management and strategy and governance implementation programmes. Also previously employed with the Innovation Team of the Dutch Ministry of Justice and Security where I contributed to the development of an innovation procurement model to improve public-private partnerships which is still in use today.

I hold a Master of Science from Leiden University in Crisis and Security Management, a Bachelor of Arts in World Politics from Leiden University College and Yale-NUS College awarded with honours, and I am a Certified Information Privacy Professional. I have additionally followed a variety of courses on Machine Learning, Ethical Hacking and Product Management. Contributed to the award-winning research project at the ICSSS hosted by Europol EC3 and NATO NCIA, studying how cryptocurrencies can be used as a means of communication, for example by criminal organisations. 

My career has a strong international component with a particular focus on Europe and Asia. As a result, I have worked hard to become fluent in 4 languages (Italian, Dutch, English and French) and proficient in 3+ other languages including Brazilian Portuguese, Chinese and Swedish.
